Articles.Content:
> 
> KasperVld posted that pic a couple of days ago, I don't think the repost has anything to do with it. 
> So is it the 8th Saros cycle?

Yes, the 8th Saros cycle has been confirmed.

> 
> I'm probably wrong,but to me I see 2 air tanks on the Kerbal's back. Then again I haven't played KSP in a while,so have those always been there? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

Yeah, nothing seems to have changed about the Kerbal Model.

BTW for those concerned, I DO know how to time accelerate. I probably should have mentioned that when I first posted since I sort of saw it coming. The thing is, I don't like timewarping too much at a time without doing some kind of mission or maneuver (more than a few days) out of pity for the poor bored kerbals back in the base. And going 180 days one week at a time takes a while.
Saros cycle. Cool, wouldn't have gotten that. Excited for tomorrows riddle. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> [![SYHAZcd.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/SYHAZcd.png?1)](http://imgur.com/SYHAZcd)

This is an slightly enlarged version.

> [![q5lLYmu.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/q5lLYmu.jpg?1)](http://imgur.com/q5lLYmu)

Here's enlarged pic of a kerbal's jetpack.
Lunar eclipse?

I wonder if this is coming out to be a date or something... If so, I am not waiting until August for 1.0. ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)

EDIT: 

> 
> Lunar eclipse?

That's what it looks like.

There's a strange countdown timer at the top of [GeoGuessr.com](http://GeoGuessr.com) saying "The great journey continues in 08:00:36:23..."

I don't think this is a coincidence.

Thing is, what would they possibly partner with SQUAD for?

> 
> Lunar eclipse?

 Aye. googling "6585 eclipse" should sort the rest of it out in short order.

Best,

-Slashy

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I wonder if this is coming out to be a date or something... If so, I am not waiting until August for 1.0. ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)
> EDIT:  
> 
> That's what it looks like.

 It's not. It's a countdown.

Best,

-Slashy
Here's the big question: Is this a countdown to release or a countdown to the release of the release date?

> 
> Here's the big question: Is this a countdown to release or a countdown to the release of the release date?

I'm thinkin' the former. Having a hyped-up countdown to the release date would be bad PR.

Best,

-Slashy
I'm so hoping that this new picture means that shadows properly propagate through SOI changes. And that when there's a Loonar eclipse it actually DOES turn red.

> 
> There's a strange countdown timer at the top of [GeoGuessr.com](http://GeoGuessr.com) saying "The great journey continues in 08:00:36:23..."
> I don't think this is a coincidence.
> 
> Thing is, what would they possibly partner with SQUAD for?

Hmmmmm..... This is odd. Now it's 07:23:05:00....

This could be KSP's countdown timer... But I don't know why it would be here either.

(Oh, BTW:)

> ![oIJO9xd.png](http://i.imgur.com/oIJO9xd.png)
I'm still putting my money on something related to photography after doing some research on the first images clues. The second has me stumped for now.

> 
> I'm still putting my money on something related to photography after doing some research on the first images clues. The second has me stumped for now.

Sorry?

 Are you trying to solve the countdown riddles on your own? If so, I'll keep my mouth shut.

Best,

-Slashy

> There's a strange countdown timer at the top of [GeoGuessr.com](http://GeoGuessr.com) saying "The great journey continues in 08:00:36:23..."
> I don't think this is a coincidence.
> 
> Thing is, what would they possibly partner with SQUAD for?

Wait... why would a countdown timer at some other random site be related to this?

> 
> Wait... why would a countdown timer at some other random site be related to this?

Could be maxmaps trolling us because people always complain that they never use the forums for some teases/announcements. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

"Fine, i'll announce it at GeoGuessr" -Maxmaps

> 
> Could be maxmaps trolling us because people always complain that they never use the forums for some teases/announcements. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> "Fine, i'll announce it at GeoGuessr" -Maxmaps

Probably tongue in cheek, but doubtful if not.

 You don't get your hype train rolling where nobody's expected to see it. That's also bad PR.

Best,

-Slashy

Gotta be a massive coincidence.

Can't find anything on their twitter or facebook about some upcoming update, though they were updating maps last month.

> 
> Sorry?
>  Are you trying to solve the countdown riddles on your own? If so, I'll keep my mouth shut.
> 
> Best,
> 
> -Slashy

Slashy if you have any idea what the riddles mean, please share with me/PM me! I'm not trying to solve them all by myself, I'm just guessing based off 10 minutes of research ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

EDIT:

And what the heck is up with all the numbers! The ones in the first clue actually made sense to me but the rest!?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T01:34:48Z" title="04/20/2015 01:34  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by Avera9eJoe**

> 
> Gotta be a massive coincidence.
> Can't find anything on their twitter or facebook about some upcoming update, though they were updating maps last month.

What is the coincidence, even? KSP has an update coming in a few days, and some other random website has a countdown to around the same time? I'm starting a new job that day, maybe they're counting down to that!

> 
> Slashy if you have any idea what the riddles mean, please share with me/PM me! I'm not trying to solve them all by myself, I'm just guessing based off 10 minutes of research ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> EDIT:
> 
> And what the heck is up with all the numbers! The ones in the first clue actually made sense to me but the rest!?

Sure. It's common knowledge here, so I'm not spoiling anything. The answers thus far have been "Apollo 10", "Venera 9" and "Saros cycle 8". We are therefore confident that tomorrow's answer will be "something-or-other 7".

 The first riddle, posted 2 days ago:

A capsule over the Mun with the crew being "L.Gordon Kerman, Jr" "Donn F. Kerman" and "Edgar Kerman". Their being over the Mun denotes a connection, and those names are weird for KSP. Googling the names gives you Gordo Cooper, Don Eisley, and Ed Mitchell. The only time those 3 were together was as the backup crew for Apollo 10 and the altitude was **Apollo 10**'s CPA to the lunar surface. 

 Next riddle was yesterday and somewhat trickier.

 An orbiter named Mares and a lander named Envision at Eve with a bunch of numbers on the mission clock. Envision and Eve both point to Venus, and "Mare/ Envision" is an anagram for "Venera Mission" Some google-fu reveals that the numbers in the mission clock correspond exactly with the numbers for **Venera 9**.

Today was a Kerbal staring at a red mun and a series of numbers "6585, 21, 7, 29, 7, 22.". A red mun is clearly a munar eclipse. Googling "eclipse 6585" reveals that a Saros cycle is 6,585 days long. 

 Looking at the Wikipedia article about Saros cycles shows that cycle #8 has it's eclipse types by occurrence in a pattern that happens to match 21,7,29,7, and 22. Therefore **Saros cycle 8**.

 So that's it so far. Tomorrow's riddle will be something-7 and you have an idea of how they're thinking when they put these together.

 Best,

-Slashy

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-20T02:54:46Z" title="04/20/2015 02:54  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 20, 2015</time> by GoSlash27**

Wasn't there one more clue the day before that. A flying lunar pod with several radial mounted engines, one missing.

>

Yeah, that was a picture of Valentina on a craft with 11 rockets visible.

We are at 8 and counting...

Happy landings!
